titles: Mans felicity and misery which is, a good wife and a bad: or the best and the worst, discoursed in a dialogue betweene Edmund and Dauid. To the tune of I haue for all good wives a song.
author: M. P. (Martin Parker), d. 1656?
notes: Signed: M. P., i.e. Martin Parker.
In two parts; woodcut illustrations at head of each part.
Another edition of STC 19253, published in 1632.
Identified as STC 19253 on UMI microfilm set "Early English books, 1641-1700", reel 2123.
Reproductions of the original in the British Library.
